text: I feel like I'm actually sick, or did Google ruin my peace again by showing me symptoms.
I frequently worry about having a serious illness, even when doctors tell me I'm healthy.
I search online for symptoms and medical information, which increases my anxiety about my health.
I interpret normal bodily sensations as signs of serious illness.
I frequently check my body for signs of illness or abnormalities.
I seek reassurance from doctors, family, or friends about my health, but the reassurance doesn't last long.
I avoid medical appointments or health-related information because I'm afraid of what I might learn.
I feel anxious or panicked when I notice any physical symptom, no matter how minor.
I have difficulty accepting that I'm healthy, even after medical tests show no problems.
I feel like my health anxiety is ruining my peace and quality of life.
I can trust my body's signals and don't immediately assume the worst about my health.
I can read about health information without becoming excessively anxious or worried.
I accept medical reassurance and don't continue to worry excessively about my health.
I can distinguish between normal bodily sensations and actual symptoms that need medical attention.
I maintain a balanced perspective on my health without excessive worry or anxiety.
I feel like I'm constantly monitoring my body for signs of illness.
I experience significant distress or anxiety related to my health concerns.
I feel like my health anxiety interferes with my daily life, work, or relationships.
I have difficulty focusing on other things because I'm so worried about my health.
I can maintain peace of mind about my health without excessive worry or anxiety.
